description: Italian contorniato, present participle of contorniare (“to make a circuit or outline”).

entries.meaning: Having a furrow of this kind.
examples: […]  by its close analogy with a more elaborate composition on a contorniate medal of the same Emperor, which was certainly commemorative of that event.

entries.meaning: A bronze medal or medallion with a deep furrow on the contour or edge, supposed to have been struck in the days of Constantine and his successors.
examples: Mr. Evans exhibited a fine contorniate, bearing the head of Nero
